name: Avoid external control of system or configuration setting through API requests
associatedValueName: Call stack from user input source down to the target method
description: Using CAST data-flow engine, this quality rule detects execution paths from API requests down to system or configuration settings, which are open vulnerabilities to injection flaws.
output:
List all methods that miss calling the required input validation calls

It provides the following information:
 - Method full name
 - Call stack from  API request down to the target method.
rationale: The software constructs all or part of a system parameter via user-controllable inputs. These inputs are not neutralized or are incorrectly neutralized. As a consequence, some applications may work with an unexpected behavior.
reference:
CWE-15: External Control of System or Configuration Setting
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/15.html

CWE-642: External Control of Critical State Data
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/642.html
remediation:
Assume all input is malicious. 
Avoid using inputs. If it is not possible, use an "accept known good" input validation strategy, i.e., use stringent white-lists that limit the character set based on the expected value of the parameter in the request. This will indirectly limit the scope of an attack.
alternativeName: Ensure you don't use have insecure parameters with system or configuration setting
